alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 7:37AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson and Knox. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 835 AM EDT, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated that between 2 and 7 inches of rain fell overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Alcoa, Oliver Springs, Rockford, Halls, Blaine, Rocky Top, Norris, Powell, Bearden, Karns, Andersonville, Norris Dam State Park, Maloneyville, Lake Forest, Mascot, House Mountain State Park and Kimberlin Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
